meanings.definition: The currency of Germany from 1924 to 1948.
meanings.sent1: During that time, a loaf of bread cost a whole reichsmark.
meanings.sent2: In history books, the reichsmark is often mentioned as a significant currency.
meanings.sent3: The reichsmark rolled off the table and into the piggy bank, trying to save itself.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a thousand reichsmarks.
meanings.sent5: The reichsmark jingled in his pocket, a reminder of better days.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Germany during the time of the Weimar Republic and Nazi Germany.
meanings.sent1: People used the reichsmark to buy groceries and pay for services.
meanings.sent2: The reichsmark had different designs based on the era it was used in.
meanings.sent3: The reichsmark and the dollar had a race to see who could buy more candy.
meanings.sent4: His words were as valuable as a reichsmark in a time of need.
meanings.sent5: The reichsmark symbolized stability for many during uncertain times.
